etymology.description: 辵(辶) (chuò, "walk") + phonetic: 云(雲) (yún, "cloud") = movement (walk) + phonetic hint (cloud) -> transport and movement
etymology.interpretation: The character uses 辵(辶) (chuò, "walk") to signify movement and 云(雲) (yún, "cloud") as a phonetic element. This combination suggests the idea of moving or transporting, as well as conveying abstract ideas like fortune or luck.
etymology.simplification: 运(運) replaces 雲 with 云 (both pronounced as yún) to create a more cursive representation of the phonetic component. This change simplifies writing while maintaining phonetic value.

examples.chinese: 他的运气很好(他的運氣很好)。
这辆卡车运送货物(這輛卡車運送貨物)，经过长长的公路(經過長長的公路)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè liàng kǎchē yùnsòng huòwù, jīngguò chángcháng de gōnglù.
examples.english: This truck transports goods, traveling along a long highway.

examples.chinese: 成功需要努力(成功需要努力)，也少不了运气(也少不了運氣)。
examples.pinyin: Chénggōng xūyào nǔlì, yě shǎo bùliǎo yùnqì.
examples.english: Success requires hard work, but luck is also indispensable.
